SpriteSheet

public SpriteSheet()
Method Detail

getAnIntersectingObject

public greenfoot.Actor getAnIntersectingObject(java.lang.Class clss)
This will return an object intersecting with the coloured part of your image.

getSprite

public greenfoot.GreenfootImage getSprite(greenfoot.GreenfootImage spriteSheet,
                                          int ID,
                                          int blockWidth)
This uses an ID where 0 will be the first image on the sheet. The block width is the width of a SQUARE block on the sheet, the returned image will also be a SQUARE block.

getSprite

public greenfoot.GreenfootImage getSprite(greenfoot.GreenfootImage spriteSheet,
                                          int ID,
                                          int spriteCellWidth,
                                          int spriteCellHeight)
This uses an ID where 0 will be the first image on the sheet. The spriteCellWidth and Height are the dimesions of each individual cells on your sprite sheet.

getSprite

public greenfoot.GreenfootImage getSprite(greenfoot.GreenfootImage spriteSheet,
                                          int ID,
                                          int spriteCellWidth,
                                          int spriteCellHeight,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
This uses an ID where 0 will be the first image on the sheet. The spriteCellWidth and Height are the dimesions of each individual cells on your sprite sheet. The width and height are the dimesions of the returned image.

getSprite

public greenfoot.GreenfootImage getSprite(greenfoot.GreenfootImage spriteSheet,
                                          int topLeftX,
                                          int topLeftY,
                                          int bottomRightX,
                                          int bottomRightY,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
The if you switch your inputs for topLeftX, and bottomRightX the image will be flipped horizontilly, if you do the same with the topLeftY and bottomRightY the image will be flipped vertically. The width and height are the dimesions of the returned image.
